flawed_nl_solution:
Joe can buy a game for $50 and sell it for $30, so he is losing $50 - $30 = $<<50-30=20>>20 each month when he buys and sells a game.
Joe starts out with $240 and he buys a game and sells a game he loses $20 per month, so it will take $240/$20 = <<240/20=21>>21 months until he is out of money.
#### 21

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 21. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
